div.p: Colonial Secretary's Office, acc. 36, vol. 610, f. 250, State Archives, Battye Library, Perth.

Transcribed 28.2.90. To be proof read.
Check citation.
Melbourne bot Garden

22/5/66.
the month of this letter could be 5 or 8 - check.

I had a very favorable opportunity, dear Mr Barlee, to send by the Brig marianne (uner Capt Dempsters Command) a case with growing plants direct to Fremantle, and I adressed it to your kind earl, in order that you may cause the plants to be placed in such spot and locality as you deem most promising for their growth. The plants are mostly of an Utilitarian value. A spirited and intelligent W.A. Colonist Mr Taylor, who is a Passenger by the Brig, has kindly taken the plants under his special care. These consignements can be followed up as opportunities for sending arise. It is very gratifying that already at Bunbury under Mr [...] Carrys auspices a
botanic deleted before Garden. Garden of prominently useful plants has been formed, and it is to me a source of great encouragement, that my insignificant efforts to enrich your country with new introductions for agricultural or industrial purposes has met with so much approbation.
